Activity: Morning routine: emails, coffee, quick scan of game development news sites.
Check-in meeting with @Ldes-1. Present yesterday's blockout progress and get feedback. Discuss any potential issues or alternative approaches.
Based on feedback from @Ldes-1, refine the blockout of the first level. Adjust pathways, resize areas, and generally polish the overall layout. Maybe add some verticality to the design.
Start prototyping enemy placement in the blocked-out areas. Focus on creating initial encounters that are challenging but not overwhelming. Consider different enemy types and their attack patterns.
Lunch. Grab a bite and chat with @3dmod-1 about potential environment assets for the first level.
Continue prototyping enemy encounters. Experiment with ambushes, flanking maneuvers, and varying enemy densities. Record observations on difficulty and player behavior.
Begin experimenting with basic lighting. Add simple point lights to highlight key areas and create a sense of atmosphere. Don't need anything fancy yet, just basic illumination.
Document progress and update @Ldes-1 on the enemy placement and lighting tests. Prepare a list of questions for @Sdes-1 regarding enemy AI behavior.
